Read The Guide

{include "default_salutation"} –

Ballots are on their way. Are you – or an eligible voter you know – ready to vote? Read our 2020 Ballot Guide.

Be an ACLU voter: Make a plan. Know the issues. Know your rights.

Being an ACLU voter means voting for our communities and our shared future. It means voting through the ballot on state and local races like your district attorney, California propositions, and local measures. Learn where the ACLU SoCal stands on key initiatives.

  • YES on Proposition 15: Vote to put schools and communities first.
  • YES on Proposition 16: Vote to reinstate affirmative action in California.
  • YES on Proposition 17: Vote to restore voting rights for people reentering.
  • YES on Proposition 18: Vote to give 17-year-olds a say on important issues affecting their lives.
  • NO on Proposition 19: Vote to prevent another tax break that benefits only the wealthy.
  • NO on Proposition 20: Vote to protect criminal justice reforms.
  • YES on Proposition 21: Vote for rent control and affordable housing.
  • NO on Proposition 22: Vote for fair wages and protections for rideshare and delivery drivers.
  • NO on Proposition 24: Vote to reject a fake privacy law that harms the privacy of vulnerable communities.
  • NO on Proposition 25: Vote to reject pretrial discrimination and make sure we end cash bail the right way.
  • YES on Measure J (Los Angeles County): Vote for health, housing, and jobs in L.A. County.

Support new laws that will promote racial and social justice. Reject those that will turn back the clock. Vote for our future.

And if you haven't yet, join our phone bank every Thursday until Election Day to the get out the vote. Sign up to be an ACLU SoCal volunteer.

Sincerely,

ACLU of {affiliate_name}
